verses.text: And it came to pass in the \w eleventh|strong="H6249"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w*, in the \w first|strong="H0259"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, \add that\add* the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto me, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,

\w Son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w*, because that \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w* hath \w said|strong="H0559"\w* against \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \w Aha|strong="H1889"\w*, she is \w broken|strong="H7665"\w* \add that was\add* the \w gates|strong="H1817"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: she is \w turned|strong="H5437"\w* unto me: I shall be \w replenished|strong="H4390"\w*, \add now\add* she is laid \w waste|strong="H2717"\w*:

Therefore thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, O \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, and will cause \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* to come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* against thee, as the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* causeth his \w waves|strong="H1530"\w* to come \w up|strong="H5927"\w*.

And they shall \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w* the \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* of \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, and break \w down|strong="H2040"\w* her \w towers|strong="H4026"\w*: I will also \w scrape|strong="H5500"\w* her \w dust|strong="H6083"\w* from her, and \w make|strong="H5414"\w* her like the \w top|strong="H6706"\w* of a \w rock|strong="H5553"\w*.

It shall be \add a place for\add* the \w spreading|strong="H4894"\w* of \w nets|strong="H2764"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*: for I have \w spoken|strong="H1696"\w* \add it\add*, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*: and it shall become a \w spoil|strong="H0957"\w* to the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*.

And her \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* which \add are\add* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w* shall be \w slain|strong="H2026"\w* by the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*; and they shall \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

¶ For thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I will \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* upon \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w* \w Nebuchadrezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, a \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w kings|strong="H4428"\w*, from the \w north|strong="H6828"\w*, with \w horses|strong="H5483"\w*, and with \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, and with \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*, and \w companies|strong="H6951"\w*, and \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.

He shall \w slay|strong="H2026"\w* with the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* thy \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*: and he shall \w make|strong="H5414"\w* a \w fort|strong="H1785"\w* against thee, and \w cast|strong="H8210"\w* a \w mount|strong="H5550"\w* against thee, and lift \w up|strong="H6965"\w* the \w buckler|strong="H6793"\w* against thee.\f + \fr 26.8 \ft cast…: or, pour out the engine of shot\f*

And he shall \w set|strong="H5414"\w* \w engines|strong="H4239"\w* of \w war|strong="H6904"\w* against thy \w walls|strong="H2346"\w*, and with his \w axes|strong="H2719"\w* he shall break \w down|strong="H5422"\w* thy \w towers|strong="H4026"\w*.

By reason of the \w abundance|strong="H8229"\w* of his \w horses|strong="H5483"\w* their \w dust|strong="H0080"\w* shall \w cover|strong="H3680"\w* thee: thy \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* shall \w shake|strong="H7493"\w* at the \w noise|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*, and of the \w wheels|strong="H1534"\w*, and of the \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, when he shall \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into thy \w gates|strong="H8179"\w*, as men \w enter|strong="H3996"\w* into a \w city|strong="H5892"\w* wherein is made a \w breach|strong="H1234"\w*.\f + \fr 26.10 \ft as men…: Heb. according to the enterings of a city broken up\f*

With the \w hoofs|strong="H6541"\w* of his \w horses|strong="H5483"\w* shall he tread \w down|strong="H7429"\w* all thy \w streets|strong="H2351"\w*: he shall \w slay|strong="H2026"\w* thy \w people|strong="H5971"\w* by the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, and thy \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w garrisons|strong="H4676"\w* shall go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*.

And they shall make a \w spoil|strong="H7997"\w* of thy \w riches|strong="H2428"\w*, and make a \w prey|strong="H0962"\w* of thy \w merchandise|strong="H7404"\w*: and they shall break \w down|strong="H2040"\w* thy \w walls|strong="H2346"\w*, and \w destroy|strong="H5422"\w* thy \w pleasant|strong="H2532"\w* \w houses|strong="H1004"\w*: and they shall \w lay|strong="H7760"\w* thy \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* and thy \w timber|strong="H6086"\w* and thy \w dust|strong="H6083"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w water|strong="H4325"\w*.\f + \fr 26.12 \ft thy pleasant…: Heb. houses of thy desire\f*

And I will cause the \w noise|strong="H1995"\w* of thy \w songs|strong="H7892"\w* to \w cease|strong="H7673"\w*; and the \w sound|strong="H6963"\w* of thy \w harps|strong="H3658"\w* shall be no more \w heard|strong="H8085"\w*.

And I will \w make|strong="H5414"\w* thee like the \w top|strong="H6706"\w* of a \w rock|strong="H5553"\w*: thou shalt be \add a place\add* to \w spread|strong="H4894"\w* \w nets|strong="H2764"\w* \w upon|strong="H4894"\w*; thou shalt be \w built|strong="H1129"\w* no more: for I the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* have \w spoken|strong="H1696"\w* \add it\add*, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d*.

¶ Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* to \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*; Shall not the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* \w shake|strong="H7493"\w* at the \w sound|strong="H6963"\w* of thy \w fall|strong="H4658"\w*, when the \w wounded|strong="H2491"\w* \w cry|strong="H0602"\w*, when the \w slaughter|strong="H2027"\w* is \w made|strong="H2026"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of thee?

Then all the \w princes|strong="H5387"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* shall come \w down|strong="H3381"\w* from their \w thrones|strong="H3678"\w*, and lay \w away|strong="H5493"\w* their \w robes|strong="H4598"\w*, and put \w off|strong="H6584"\w* their \w broidered|strong="H7553"\w* \w garments|strong="H0899"\w*: they shall \w clothe|strong="H3847"\w* themselves with \w trembling|strong="H2731"\w*; they shall \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* upon the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*, and shall \w tremble|strong="H2729"\w* at \add every\add* \w moment|strong="H7281"\w*, and be \w astonished|strong="H8074"\w* at thee.\f + \fr 26.16 \ft trembling: Heb. tremblings\f*

And they shall take \w up|strong="H5375"\w* a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w* for thee, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w* to thee, How art thou \w destroyed|strong="H0006"\w*, \add that wast\add* \w inhabited|strong="H3427"\w* of seafaring \w men|strong="H3220"\w*, the \w renowned|strong="H1984"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, which wast \w strong|strong="H2389"\w* in the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, she and her \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w*, which \w cause|strong="H5414"\w* their \w terror|strong="H2851"\w* \add to be\add* on all that \w haunt|strong="H3427"\w* it!\f + \fr 26.17 \ft of…: Heb. of the seas\f*

Now shall the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* \w tremble|strong="H2729"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of thy \w fall|strong="H4658"\w*; yea, the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* that \add are\add* in the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* shall be \w troubled|strong="H0926"\w* at thy \w departure|strong="H3318"\w*.

For thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; When I shall \w make|strong="H5414"\w* thee a \w desolate|strong="H2717"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, like the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* that are not \w inhabited|strong="H3427"\w*; when I shall bring \w up|strong="H5927"\w* the \w deep|strong="H8415"\w* upon thee, and \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* shall \w cover|strong="H3680"\w* thee;

When I shall bring thee \w down|strong="H3381"\w* with them that \w descend|strong="H3381"\w* into the \w pit|strong="H0953"\w*, with the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of old \w time|strong="H5769"\w*, and shall \w set|strong="H3427"\w* thee in the low \w parts|strong="H8482"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, in places \w desolate|strong="H2723"\w* of \w old|strong="H5769"\w*, with them that go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to the \w pit|strong="H0953"\w*, that thou be not \w inhabited|strong="H3427"\w*; and I shall \w set|strong="H5414"\w* \w glory|strong="H6643"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of the \w living|strong="H2416"\w*;

I will \w make|strong="H5414"\w* thee a \w terror|strong="H1091"\w*, and thou \add shalt be\add* no \add more:\add* though thou be sought \w for|strong="H1245"\w*, yet shalt thou \w never|strong="H5769"\w* be \w found|strong="H4672"\w* again, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 26.21 \ft a terror: Heb. terrors\f*
